page.title: 07LARKHALL SOLAR_ENERGY
page.content: IN LARKHALL THERE ARE ABOUT 14 HOUSES WHICH USE SOLAR ENERGY.THEY ARE IN THE AREA OF LARKHALL CALLED STRUTHERHILL. THE SYSTEM IN THE CONSISTS OF PANELS IN THE ROOF WHICH ABSORB HEAT FROM THE SUN.THE PANELS HEAT UP AND THE HEAT MIXES WITH THE AIR AND THIS HEAT GOES ROUND THE HOUSE.EACH ROOM HAS A VENT WHERE THE HOT AIR COMES OUT.WHEN THERE IS NOT ENOUGH SUN TO HEAT THE HOUSES ,THE GAS OR ELECTRICITY TURNS ON AUTOMATICALLY.THERE IS ALSO A SEPARATE METHOD IN THE WINTER WHICH HEATS THE WATER. THIS SYSTEM IS ALSO CONNECTED TO THE GAS AND ELECTRICITY WHICH HEATS THE HOUSE IF THERE IS NOT ENOUGH SUN. MOST OF THE PEOPLE LIVING IN THESE HOUSES ARE OLD AGE PENSIONERS AND THEY FOUND THE SOLAR ENERGY MUCH CHEAPER THAN THE GAS AND ELECTRICITY ESPECIALLY IN THE SUMMER.
